meanings.definition: A soft candy made from sugar, butter, and milk.
meanings.sent1: I love to eat fudge after dinner.
meanings.sent2: She bought some delicious fudge from the store.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa joked that he could make fudge better than anyone.
meanings.sent4: The fudge was as sweet as a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fudge filled the kitchen with happiness.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or adjust in order to deceive or present a false impression.
meanings.sent1: He tried to fudge the numbers to make the report look better.
meanings.sent2: Politicians sometimes fudge the truth to win votes.
meanings.sent3: The magician fudged his trick and made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: She had to fudge her way out of a difficult situation.
meanings.sent5: The student fudged his answers on the test and got caught.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to his fudge; he's just joking around.
meanings.sent2: The movie was full of silly fudge that made us laugh.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meowing sounded like fudge to the dog.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses were just a bunch of fudge.
meanings.sent5: The children's play was a delightful mix of fun and fudge.
